channel.title: Phone choice?
channel.description:
ok the choices id like are samsung gs2, gs1, nexus s 4g, or iphone 4s 8gb. the latter 3 are $99 with a 2 year contract, the gs2 is $199. I really would like the gs2 and pretty sure its the best choice out of all 4. I really wouldn't want to go to an iphone but for some reason its temping. they all pretty much has a set amount of storage except for the gs1 has an sd card slot i think.
These are all sprint phones, i guess i have a choice of going to another carrier like verizon but I like not having to pay extra for limited data, even though verizon has better coverage.
I have used all 4 in in-store demo models or whatever and they all seem nice. What do you think is the best choice?

Stupit:

Get a 4s, I have one. AMAZING FUCKING PHONE! I’ll take some pictures for you if you want to see the quality of the camera on it.

item.title: Phone choice?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

thx for the responses. this was a college graduation/xmas present.

I got the epic touch! its is awesome. I held the iphone next to it at the store and it seemed like the iphone could fit in the screen of the gs2, even though i played around with one b4 i wasnt truly aware how large a 4.5" screen was. also i was watching a movie on it, wow the video was so crisp idk what to compare it to. I was playing MCP on it earlier; awesome.

I’m sure ill enjoy it the next 2 years, even though its going to be outdated in a couple months. but im sure its going to be able to handle anything I throw at it.

ill make a thread over at mitb asking about if i should put cm7 on it or some other rom. I’m also run lubuntu on it thru chroot( http://androlinux.com/android-ubuntu-development/how-to-install-ubuntu-on-android/ not all the time, just for the fun of it[rs? maybe if it can] and i want to use linux software or something.).

Read full topic

item.title: Phone choice?
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

I own a Droid X2, love it. Usually most of the droids are nice pieces of hardware. I just love the software on the droid because of the amount of capabilities. I vote for the Nexus.

Read full topic
